about_the_game:
Long Live the Great, Glorious Nation of Belegovska

Yes Comrade is a multiplayer survival sandbox where players have been based at a remote military lighthouse to complete tasks in the name of the country’s sea defence. 

Called in to take over after the previous members of the Lighthouse went crazy and trashed the place, you have been reassigned to man the sea outpost and continue the protection of the State's sea border and secrets.  

You start on a small motor boat in a foggy ocean set for the remote posting. As you arrive at the lighthouse the fog begins to clear and the brutalist architecture of the lighthouse shows. Run down and historic, this building hasn’t seen any repairs for quite some time. 

The lighthouse is a mess, trash piles are scattered everywhere, the furniture tipped over or pushed to one side. It's time to start the clean up process.

Ships need to be looked out for from the top of the lighthouse. Around the top of the ceiling is a compass for directing the communication radio. Depending on the type of ship different frequencies of radio need to be used to communicate with the ship. All messages sent to the ships are pre-recorded. Messages sent back are translated on screen. A manual of the ship's flags and styles can be found next to the communication desk. Some ships will be friendly and you can decide if you want to let them through. You have to check some elements of the ship (flag the correct way) and accept or turn them away as necessary.

The polaroid camera is used to capture anomalies seen while working the lighthouse. Images should be developed in the dark room of the basement (red room), then scanned at the computer and sent to Party Headquarters.

Decorating is a fundamental part of the game and allows customisation of the lighthouse in many ways. This can include wallpapering walls, putting up posters and decorations, buying and placing furniture, and much more.

Play the way you want to play with your friends; just stay alive while serving and protecting the greatest nation on earth.
